snippet: New research suggests that male blue tits are more attentive to their babies if the mother is attractive.
abstract: Study published online in journal Frontiers in Zoology finds that male blue tits, unlike many other birds, judge females visually, and are more attentive fathers to their babies if the mother bird is more colorful.
lead_paragraph: New research suggests that male blue tits are more attentive to their babies if the mother is attractive.

headline.print_headline: For These Flashy Males, No Modest Mate Will Do
headline.seo: For These Flashy Male Birds, No Modest Mate Will Do
headline.main: For These Flashy Males, No Modest Mate Will Do
